paragraphs.subheading: What are the other data types?
paragraphs.content: This topic discusses the rest of the most commonly used data types in Java, all of which are designed store completely different types of data.
A boolean stores either true or false. They are primarily used in while loops (covered later).

images.caption: 'Example of two booleans; one true and one false'

paragraphs.content: A char stores single characters only. The character being stored as a char must be surrounded with single quotation marks.
A String essentially combines and stores a list of characters. A String must be surrounded by double quotation marks to indicate its a String and not a char.

paragraphs.subheading: String, character, boolean and floating point questions

openChoiceQuiz.question: Finish the missing keyword: _____ data = 'a';
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! Because the data is only one character and the data is surrounded by singular quotes, it is a char.
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is char. This is because the data is only one character and the data is surrounded by singular quotes.

openChoiceQuiz.question: Finish the missing keyword: _____ data = 30.6d;
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is double. This is because the data ends in a 'd' and it has a decimal point.

openChoiceQuiz.question: Finish the missing keyword: _____ data = false;
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! It is a boolean because booleans are either true or false.
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is boolean. This is because booleans are either true or false.

openChoiceQuiz.question: Finish the missing keyword: _____ data = 30.6f;
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! Keep going, you are remembering most of the content on this topic!
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is float. This is because the data ends in a 'f' and it has a decimal point.

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: A string can only store words and no numbers.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! A string can store numbers too, but they cannot be operated on.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! Strings can store numbers too, but they cannot be operated on. If you want to store numbers which you want to operate on, store them as an integer data type.

multipleChoiceQuiz.question: What data type should I use to store 'Hello'?
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! A string is the only possible data type to store the data.
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is string. A string is the only possible data type to store the data.
